comments:
I got the error below installing a bundle manually (a more recent version of an
existing bundle) and starting it (the only to force resolution through the
command-line, isn't). It seems the message is from the time the PackageAdmin
passed a subset of bundles to be resolved. Today a full resolution is done, so
it is normal that the existing bundle gets unresolved.

!ENTRY reference:file:/d:/target/releasing/plugins/org.eclipse.core.variables/ 0
0 Apr 23, 2004 00:42:25.55
!MESSAGE FrameworkEvent.ERROR
!STACK 0
org.osgi.framework.BundleException: The state unresolved a bundle that was not
in the list of bundles to resolve:
reference:file:/d:/target/releasing/plugins/org.eclipse.core.variables/
	at
org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.PackageAdminImpl.resolveBundles(PackageAdminImpl.java:776)
	at
org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.BundleHost.startWorker(BundleHost.java:392)
	at
org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.AbstractBundle.start(AbstractBundle.java:298)
	at
org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.FrameworkCommandProvider._start(FrameworkCommandProvider.java:226)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
	at
sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:324)
	at
org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.FrameworkCommandInterpreter.execute(FrameworkCommandInterpreter.java:140)
	at
org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.FrameworkConsole.docommand(FrameworkConsole.java:286)
	at
org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.FrameworkConsole.console(FrameworkConsole.java:271)
	at
org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.FrameworkConsole.console(FrameworkConsole.java:231)
	at
org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.FrameworkConsole.run(FrameworkConsole.java:206)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:534)
org.osgi.framework.BundleException: The singlton bundle
"file:d:/i20040420a/eclipse/plugins/org.eclipse.core.variables_3.0.0" could not
be resolved because another singlton bundle
"reference:file:/d:/target/releasing/plugins/org.eclipse.core.variables/" is
resolved and has the same Bundle-SymbolicName.
	at
org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.BundleHost.startWorker(BundleHost.java:395)
	at
org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.AbstractBundle.start(AbstractBundle.java:298)
	at
org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.FrameworkCommandProvider._start(FrameworkCommandProvider.java:226)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
	at
sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:324)
	at
org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.FrameworkCommandInterpreter.execute(FrameworkCommandInterpreter.java:140)
	at
org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.FrameworkConsole.docommand(FrameworkConsole.java:286)
	at
org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.FrameworkConsole.console(FrameworkConsole.java:271)
	at
org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.FrameworkConsole.console(FrameworkConsole.java:231)
	at
org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.FrameworkConsole.run(FrameworkConsole.java:206)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:534)

Yep, this is an invalid error message.  The Framework should just ignore this 
situation.  And not post an error.

traces.message: The state unresolved a bundle that was not in the list of bundles to resolve: reference:file:/d:/target/releasing/plugins/org.eclipse.core.variables/

The singlton bundle "file:d:/i20040420a/eclipse/plugins/org.eclipse.core.variables_3.0.0" could not be resolved because another singlton bundle "reference:file:/d:/target/releasing/plugins/org.eclipse.core.variables/" is resolved and has the same Bundle-SymbolicName.
